intro: Ranunculus schraderianus, commonly known as the Schrader's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange, with five to seven petals. The plant has palmate leaves that are deeply divided, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
